projects.title: ChemScreen
projects.description:
The current system of risk assessment of chemicals is complex, very resource-intensive and extremely time-consuming. Because of this, there is a great need to modernize this process. However, this is not feasible without alternative, integrated testing strategies in which chemical characteristics are used to more advantage and where costly and time consuming animal tests are replaced to a large extent by more rapid, cheap and ethically less controversial methods. This is particularly needed for reproductive toxicity testing of chemicals. Reproductive toxicity is important to assess both human and environmental toxicity and uses the most animals in toxicity testing. Unfortunately, there are very few alternative methods. ChemScreen aims to fill this gap and place the tests in a more general innovative animal free testing strategy.

* ChemScreen is a collaborative project funded by the European Union (FP7; Environment programme)
* It has 9 partners from 5  European countries
* Strong link to US-EPA NCCT (Toxcast, Tox21)
* Sister project of the NCCT/STAR centre

profile_positions.description: Member of the organising committee of the Utrecht honours conference 2016 (UHC'16), which will be held from 1-4 June 2016. The UHC'16 is an international conference organised by the University of Applied Sciences, Utrecht and Utrecht University. The theme of the conference is "honours futures" and it is open for students, teachers and staff involved in honours education
profile_positions.title: Organising committee, Utrecht honours conference 2016

profile_positions.description:
PhD student at the Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences (IRAS) department of (Endocrine) Toxicology of Prof. Martin van den Berg, PhD of Utrecht University in Utrecht, NL. Performing scientific research in the (bio)medical research field.
Research topic: scientific validation and implementation of in vitro alternative assays for compounds toxic by interference with sex steroid hormone production, i.e. steroidogenesis.
Promotors: Prof. Martin van den Berg, PhD and Prof. Aldert H. Piersma, PhD.
Co-promotor: Majorie B.M. van Duursen, PhD.
PhD defense date: March 1, 2016.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate
